$interpreted: Law: Miranda, can ye apprehend the meaning of your master's words?
Law: You must control the seven emotions and six desires, and sublimate thy anger into Qi energy...
Law: Miranda, your response?
Miranda: Master, I understand...I'm still trying.
Law: Excellent. My efforts are not in vain.
Miranda: Um, Master, when you count to three, is that also a form of self-cultivation?
Law: Indeed. I constantly exhort myself to suppress the fire within. Unless absolutely necessary, one must not take action...much less take a life.
Miranda: ...It doesn't appear to be efficacious, what with you being unable to master it and all.
Law: What words did thou just utter?
Miranda: You've misunderstood, Master. What I meant was...
Miranda: Master's Qi energy is more powerful than the stars above...If that power is unleashed, perhaps we won't be able to participate in this great tourney?
Law: There is a heaven beyond heaven. Do not excessively praise your master. What's more...
Law: ...to imagine that the master has mastered Qi, well that would mean I have nothing to hope for.
Miranda: What are you saying? Master, are you ill? Or does that demon energy from an enemy's blade still remain inside you, after all these years...
Law: Your master is as healthy as a horse, and I hold no grudges. What is this demon energy you speak of? Thou musn't fabricate histories of your master!
Law: When I was young, I was quite gifted, and what followed was the sin of pride. I imagined I would become one of the Grandmasters.
Law: But, alas...something laid heavy on my heart, preventing me from succeeding.
Miranda: Something...you mean when you were young, what happened with your old friend? That which you do not wish to recall?
Law: Eh? How didst thou know 'twas he?
Miranda: Last time you and Lord Maeok went drinking to reminisce about old times, you told me yourself. You were so drunk you couldn't even walk straight.
Law: A blunder, arisen from the springs of mountain dew. One ought not...
Law: ...eh?
Miranda: Master?
Miranda: Wah! Master, what are you doing?
Law: I know that Qi...!
Miranda: M-M-Master! Wait for your disciple!

Yan-Bo: Yet I should kill thee with much cherishing.
Good night, good night!
Yes, now the next line...

Yan-Bo: Partying is such sweet sorrow, 
that the wine is gone 'till it be 'morrow...
Yan-Bo: ...the correct phrasing, this is.
Law: Indeed it is!
Yan-Bo: ...Law, it is you.
Law: Thou darest have thee balls to utter my name! On guard!
Miranda: Master, you ran so fast...who is this?
Law: Yan-Bo, you despicable rat! Why did thou leave the East Alliance so long ago, without so much as a farewell!
Miranda: Yan-Bo...I know that name, that's...
Yan-Bo: Old friend, anger have not. A drink, shall we enjoy one together?
Law: A drink! You've bullied me intolerably...
Miranda: Master! Three! Count to three!
Law: ...Hmph!
Yan-Bo: Long time, it has been. Unbearable happiness, I have within.

Yan-Bo: Maple Lake, heavenly scenery, it has. My old friend, a long journey you have traveled. Linger a few days as my guest, why don't you? 
This old capybara will take care of you, he will...
Law: Thoust speak of friendship!? What's more, we've important matters to attend to. You better own up to your faults or I'll tear this whole lake apart!
Miranda: Master, how about this. I'll take care of everything in Whistlewood Valley. You stay here with your old friend and talk of old times.
Law: Miranda, what devilish words have come out of thee mouth...
Miranda: Yan-Bo, sir. Please, take care of my master for the time being.
Miranda: I will return immediately upon the completion of my task!
Law: Miranda, don't ye dare act on your own accord!
Yan-Bo: ...A fair and reasonable child, she is.
Yan-Bo: A good disciple, you have.
Law: ...One day. I shall stay for just one day. Miranda, you take care. Don't go wandering off.
Miranda: Yes, Master.
Law: As for you...
Law: I shall see. Whether or not you can appease me in a day's time!

Model.Text: Miranda, can ye apprehend the meaning of your master's words?
You must control the seven emotions and six desires, and sublimate thy anger into Qi energy...
Miranda, your response?
Master, I understand...I'm still trying.
Excellent. My efforts are not in vain.
Um, Master, when you count to three, is that also a form of self-cultivation?
Indeed. I constantly exhort myself to suppress the fire within. Unless absolutely necessary, one must not take action...much less take a life.
...It doesn't appear to be efficacious, what with you being unable to master it and all.
What words did thou just utter?
You've misunderstood, Master. What I meant was...
Master's Qi energy is more powerful than the stars above...If that power is unleashed, perhaps we won't be able to participate in this great tourney?
There is a heaven beyond heaven. Do not excessively praise your master. What's more...
...to imagine that the master has mastered Qi, well that would mean I have nothing to hope for.
What are you saying? Master, are you ill? Or does that demon energy from an enemy's blade still remain inside you, after all these years...
Your master is as healthy as a horse, and I hold no grudges. What is this demon energy you speak of? Thou musn't fabricate histories of your master!
When I was young, I was quite gifted, and what followed was the sin of pride. I imagined I would become one of the Grandmasters.
But, alas...something laid heavy on my heart, preventing me from succeeding.
Something...you mean when you were young, what happened with your old friend? That which you do not wish to recall?
Eh? How didst thou know 'twas he?
Last time you and Lord Maeok went drinking to reminisce about old times, you told me yourself. You were so drunk you couldn't even walk straight.
A blunder, arisen from the springs of mountain dew. One ought not...
Master?
Wah! Master, what are you doing?
I know that Qi...!
M-M-Master! Wait for your disciple!

Yet I should kill thee with much cherishing.
Good night, good night!
Yes, now the next line...

Partying is such sweet sorrow, 
that the wine is gone 'till it be 'morrow...
...the correct phrasing, this is.
Indeed it is!
...Law, it is you.
Thou darest have thee balls to utter my name! On guard!
Master, you ran so fast...who is this?
Yan-Bo, you despicable rat! Why did thou leave the East Alliance so long ago, without so much as a farewell!
Yan-Bo...I know that name, that's...
Old friend, anger have not. A drink, shall we enjoy one together?
A drink! You've bullied me intolerably...
Master! Three! Count to three!
...Hmph!
Long time, it has been. Unbearable happiness, I have within.

Maple Lake, heavenly scenery, it has. My old friend, a long journey you have traveled. Linger a few days as my guest, why don't you? 
This old capybara will take care of you, he will...
Thoust speak of friendship!? What's more, we've important matters to attend to. You better own up to your faults or I'll tear this whole lake apart!
Master, how about this. I'll take care of everything in Whistlewood Valley. You stay here with your old friend and talk of old times.
Miranda, what devilish words have come out of thee mouth...
Yan-Bo, sir. Please, take care of my master for the time being.
I will return immediately upon the completion of my task!
Miranda, don't ye dare act on your own accord!
...A fair and reasonable child, she is.
A good disciple, you have.
...One day. I shall stay for just one day. Miranda, you take care. Don't go wandering off.
Yes, Master.
As for you...
I shall see. Whether or not you can appease me in a day's time!
